SENT.plain: We present our experience with implantation of an Ahmed glaucoma valve in a 9-year-old girl with Sturge-Weber syndrome with choroidal hemangioma
In this case of childhood glaucoma, the choice of surgical procedure should be based on the efficacy and elimination of intra-and post-operative complications
An Ahmed glaucoma valve offered safety and efficacy in controlling glaucoma
This technique avoided sudden drops in intraocular pressure and decreases the risk of intraoperative and postoperative choroidal effusion and hemorrhage
The surgical procedure was not complicated: a one-staged implant was satisfactory and a prophylactic sclerostomy was not required
